verses.verse: Open <WH6605> your doors, <WH1817> O Lebanon, <WH3844> That a fire <WH784> may feed <WH398> on your cedars. <WH730>

Wail, <WH3213> O cypress, <WH1265> for the cedar <WH730> has fallen, <WH5307> Because <WH834> the glorious <WH117> [trees] have been destroyed; <WH7703> Wail, <WH3213> O oaks <WH437> of Bashan, <WH1316> For the impenetrable <WH1219> forest <WH9194> has come <WH3381> down. <WH3381>

There is a sound <WH6963> of the shepherds' wail, <WH3215> For their glory <WH155> is ruined; <WH7703> There is a sound <WH6963> of the young <WH3715> lions' roar, <WH7581> For the pride <WH1347> of the Jordan <WH3383> is ruined. <WH7703>
Thus <WH3541> says <WH559> the Lord <WH3068> my God, <WH430> "Pasture <WH7462> the flock <WH6629> [doomed] to slaughter. <WH2028>

"Those who <WH834> buy <WH7069> them slay <WH2026> them and go <WH816> unpunished, <WH3808> <WH816> and [each of] those who sell <WH4376> them says, <WH559> 'Blessed <WH1288> be the Lord, <WH3068> for I have become <WH6238> rich! <WH6238>' And their own shepherds <WH7462> have <WH2550> no <WH3808> pity <WH2550> on them.

"For I shall no <WH3808> longer <WH5750> have <WH2550> pity <WH2550> on the inhabitants <WH3427> of the land, <WH776>" declares <WH5002> the Lord; <WH3068> "but behold, <WH2009> I shall cause the men <WH120> to fall, <WH4672> each <WH376> into another's power <WH3027> and into the power <WH3027> of his king; <WH4428> and they will strike <WH3807> the land, <WH776> and I shall not deliver <WH5337> [them] from their power. <WH3027>"

So I pastured <WH7462> the flock <WH6629> [doomed] to slaughter, <WH2028> hence <WH3651> the afflicted <WH6041> of the flock. <WH6629> And I took <WH3947> for myself two <WH8147> staffs: <WH4731> the one <WH259> I called <WH7121> Favor, <WH5278> and the other <WH259> I called <WH7121> Union; <WH9115> so I pastured <WH7462> the flock. <WH6629>

Then I annihilated <WH3582> the three <WH7969> shepherds <WH7462> in one <WH259> month, <WH3391> for my soul <WH5315> was impatient <WH9527> with them, and their soul <WH5315> also <WH1571> was weary <WH973> of me.

Then I said, <WH559> "I will not pasture <WH7462> you. What is to die, <WH4191> let it die, <WH4191> and what is to be annihilated, <WH3582> let it be annihilated; <WH3582> and let those who are left <WH7604> eat <WH398> one <WH802> another's flesh. <WH1320>"

And I took <WH3947> my staff, <WH4731> Favor, <WH5278> and cut <WH1438> it in pieces, <WH1438> to break <WH6565> my covenant <WH1285> which <WH834> I had made <WH3772> with all <WH3605> the peoples. <WH5971>

So it was broken <WH6565> on that day, <WH3117> and thus <WH3651> the afflicted <WH6041> of the flock <WH6629> who were watching <WH8104> me realized <WH3045> that it was the word <WH1697> of the Lord. <WH3068>

And I said <WH559> to them, "If <WH518> it is good <WH2896> in your sight, <WH5869> give <WH3051> [me] my wages; <WH7939> but if <WH518> not, never <WH2308> mind! <WH2308>" So they weighed <WH8254> out thirty <WH7970> [shekels] of silver <WH3701> as my wages.

Then the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> to me, "Throw <WH7993> it to the potter, <WH3335> [that] magnificent <WH145> price <WH3366> at which <WH834> I was valued <WH3365> by them." So I took <WH3947> the thirty <WH7970> [shekels] of silver <WH3701> and threw <WH7993> them to the potter <WH3335> in the house <WH1004> of the Lord. <WH3068>
Then I cut <WH1438> my second <WH8145> staff, <WH4731> Union, <WH9115> in pieces, <WH1438> to break <WH6565> the brotherhood <WH264> between <WH996> Judah <WH3063> and Israel. <WH3478>
And the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> to me, "Take <WH3947> again <WH5750> for yourself the equipment <WH3627> of a foolish <WH196> shepherd. <WH7462>

"For behold, <WH2009> I am going to raise <WH6965> up a shepherd <WH7462> in the land <WH776> who will not care <WH6485> for the perishing, <WH3582> seek <WH1245> the scattered, <WH5289> heal <WH7495> the broken, <WH7665> or sustain <WH3557> the one standing, <WH5324> but will devour <WH398> the flesh <WH1320> of the fat <WH1277> [sheep] and tear <WH6561> off <WH6561> their hoofs. <WH6541>

"Woe <WH1945> to the worthless <WH457> shepherd <WH7473> Who leaves <WH5800> the flock! <WH6629> A sword <WH2719> will be on his arm <WH2220> And on his right <WH3225> eye! <WH5869> His arm <WH2220> will be totally <WH3001> withered, <WH3001> And his right <WH3225> eye <WH5869> will be blind. <WH3543>"
